<td style="padding-top:20px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good Saturday morning. </strong>Today, Morning Brew would like to make a major policy announcement: We are endorsing Light Roast for All. Instead of shipping you a regular Brew on Monday (MLK Day), we are going to send everyone Light Roast, which is our Sunday newsletter for readers with three referrals. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>So just to recap: On Monday you’ll be receiving Light Roast, not the standard Brew. It’s still good, don’t worry.</span></li>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PRIVATE EQUITY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/17/dave-busters-becomes-private-equity-pawn?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Dave & Buster’s Becomes a Private Equity Pawn
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="A beer glass filled with Dave & Buster's icons " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc5Mjk3NjYzLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, private equity giant KKR <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-01-17/dave-buster-s-shares-surge-after-kkr-discloses-6-3-stake?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">disclosed</a> a 10.7% stake in Dave & Buster’s. KKR said it has had and will continue to have conversations with management and stakeholders about pushing for change at the Times Square of restaurant chains.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">That’s like a fish riding a bicycle: </strong>not something you see every day. As Axios’s Dan Primack <a href="https://www.axios.com/kkr-dave-busters-buyout-85f651c2-35bb-42fb-98d7-053af6ca09ca.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">points out</a>, buyout firms like KKR have built reputations as management friendly. It’s not a hostile takeover yet, but...in publicly stating that it’s pursuing major changes at Dave & Buster’s, KKR sounds more like an activist investor than your friendly neighborhood PE shop.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What’s going on</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Private equity and activist investing have always been prime “difference between” Google search material. But lately, “Private equity funds are <a href="https://corpgov.law.harvard.edu/2019/04/10/private-equity-and-activism/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">beginning to adopt</a> activist tactics and activists are increasingly engaging in private equity transactions,” writes Sidley Austin associate Amadeus Moeser.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Some examples:</strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Private equity firms like KKR, Sycamore, and Golden Gate Capital have built up “toehold” stakes in public companies (usually under 5%) as a means of getting in front of management to start talking buyout options.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>And activists like Elliott Management have started buying entire companies, typically a strategy reserved for PE.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">One reason Robin Thicke is playing: </strong>Activist investors and private equity often target similar types of companies, making it easy to swap investment strategies. As long as you change something so the teacher doesn’t notice.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Still...</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">There could be a reason KKR is exploring hard-line options for D&B—such as board changes—that don’t really seem like options:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Dave & Buster’s stock had fallen 18.5% in a year before Friday’s announcement.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The chain has almost $1.9 billion of debt. Its market cap was about $1.3 billion Thursday.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It said this week that same-store sales will fall 2.5% to 3% in the fiscal year that ends early February.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">After KKR disclosed the stake, Dave & Buster’s shares climbed 12.7% Friday.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HOUSING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/17/new-home-construction-hits-13year-high-december?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Shingle Bells, Shingle Bells
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Photo of a new home under construction in a residential area." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MTc0L3Bob3RvX29mX2FfbmV3X2hvbWVfdW5kZXJfY29uc3RydWN0aW9uX2luX2FfcmVzaWRlbnRpYWxfYXJlYS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Paul Brennan / Public Domain Pictures</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Anyone else get a three-bed, two-bath Colonial for Christmas? New home construction <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-economy/u-s-housing-starts-at-13-year-high-factory-output-gains-idUSKBN1ZG1KP?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rose 16.9%</a> annually in December to hit its highest level in 13 years. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Where homebuilding companies should send thank you notes:<strong style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Jerome Powell: </strong></span><span>The Fed cut the benchmark interest rate three times last year, dragging down </span><span><a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/01/17/economy/december-housing-construction/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">mortgage rates</a></span><span> with it. Homebuyers pounced on the lower borrowing costs.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Temperatures: </strong></span><span><span>Those balmy December days got folks in the </span></span><span><a href="https://www.ft.com/content/364c7122-392e-11ea-a6d3-9a26f8c3cba4?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">construction mood</a></span><span><span>. </span></span><span>
</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">The strong labor market: </strong></span><span><span>Higher wages and low unemployment are padding wallets and juicing the housing market. </span></span><span>
</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">An <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-01-17/u-s-housing-starts-surged-last-month-to-highest-in-13-years?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">index</a> of homebuilder stocks touched its highest since 2005 at the market open Friday. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Buzz Killington: </strong>Few analysts think this historic growth can last, pointing to constraints in labor, land, and materials as speed bumps moving forward. They may have a point. Building <em>permits</em>, considered a leading indicator of the property market, fell 3.9% last month. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/17/2020-davos-guest-list?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Our Davos Invite Got Lost in the Mail...Again
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Davos, Switzerland" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc5MjkxNTU2LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">At least <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-01-17/dalio-dimon-and-117-other-billionaires-set-to-descend-on-davos?srnd=premium&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">119 billionaires</a> will breeze through TSA Pre-Pre-Pre-Pre-Pre-PreCheck before jetting to Davos, Switzerland, for the 50th annual World Economic Forum meeting starting Tuesday. The three-comma contingent, which includes Jamie Dimon, Ray Dalio, and other employers of private chefs, will join a guest list of more than 2,000 attendees from 100 countries. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Who else is going?</h2>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Greta Thunberg. </strong></span><span>The 17-year-old environmental activist will attempt to persuade the wealthy boomers to care about the climate crisis. She might also bring some of the 10,000 climate protesters she </span><span><a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-climate-change-protests/you-have-not-seen-anything-yet-climate-activist-greta-says-ahead-of-davos-idUSKBN1ZG1UG?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">marched with</a></span><span> in the Swiss city of Lausanne yesterday.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Ren Zhengfei.</strong></span><span> The Huawei founder will </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/01/14/wef-2020-heres-who-is-going-to-davos-this-year.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">split his time</a></span><span> stumping for 5G tech and trying to convince world leaders not to ban his company.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">And finally, President Trump. </strong></span><span>He </span><span><a href="https://www.newsweek.com/trump-attend-world-economic-forum-davos-2020-1482632?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">skipped</a></span><span> Davos last year while the government was partially shut down.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>The Davos theme this year is “Stakeholders for a Cohesive and Sustainable World.” But any progress toward that world could get <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/01/17/here-are-the-main-themes-at-world-economic-forum-2020.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">awkward</a>—from billionaires attempting to solve income inequality to President Trump facing Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy as the Senate impeachment trial gets going.</p>

FASHION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/17/beyoncs-ivy-park-x-adidas-collection-goes-live?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Beyoncé Breaks the Internet
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<img alt="Beyonce " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc2ODUxMTYyLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Parkwood Entertainment/Melina Matsoukas</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Beyoncé’s Ivy Park x Adidas collection launches today after <a href="https://www.cnn.com/style/article/beyonce-ivy-park-tease-video-intl-scli/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">nine long months</a> of hype, which means for the first time ever we’re closely eyeing the business prospects of neon orange-striped tracksuits.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture:</strong> Celebrities not booking gigs at The Rock’s pace need to up their influencer game. Beyoncé’s strategy—based on <a href="https://www.fastcompany.com/90452721/what-beyonces-ivy-park-x-adidas-launch-means-for-the-new-age-of-celebrity-brands?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ownership</a>, not a hashtag—looks promising.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Beyoncé launched her athleisure brand with British retailer Topshop, then pulled the line after <span>Topshop's</span> owner was accused of sexual harassment. She then bought back full control and took her talents to celeb-friendly Adidas.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>At Adidas, Kanye West’s Yeezy reportedly did $1.5 billion in sales last year, 5% of which Kanye claims in royalties.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>That sets sole Ivy Park owner Beyoncé up for a payout much more lucrative than that offered by skinny tea or hair vitamins.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>experts think Beyoncé’s line <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/01/16/adidas-is-banking-on-beyonce-for-growth-with-ivy-park-athleticwear-line-debut.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">could top</a> Kanye’s. If Yeezy lifted him from $50 million in debt to billionaire, does that mean Beyoncé will be <span>clipping Bezos's heels</span>?</p>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nPRIVATE EQUITY \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nDave \u0026 Buster’s Becomes a Private Equity Pawn\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"A beer glass filled with Dave \u0026 Buster's icons \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc5Mjk3NjYzLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, private equity giant KKR \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-01-17/dave-buster-s-shares-surge-after-kkr-discloses-6-3-stake?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edisclosed\u003c/a\u003e a 10.7% stake in Dave \u0026 Buster’s. KKR said it has had and will continue to have conversations with management and stakeholders about pushing for change at the Times Square of restaurant chains.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThat’s like a fish riding a bicycle: \u003c/strong\u003enot something you see every day. As Axios’s Dan Primack \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/kkr-dave-busters-buyout-85f651c2-35bb-42fb-98d7-053af6ca09ca.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epoints out\u003c/a\u003e, buyout firms like KKR have built reputations as management friendly. It’s not a hostile takeover yet, but...in publicly stating that it’s pursuing major changes at Dave \u0026 Buster’s, KKR sounds more like an activist investor than your friendly neighborhood PE shop.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat’s going on\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePrivate equity and activist investing have always been prime “difference between” Google search material. But lately, “Private equity funds are \u003ca href=\"https://corpgov.law.harvard.edu/2019/04/10/private-equity-and-activism/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebeginning to adopt\u003c/a\u003e activist tactics and activists are increasingly engaging in private equity transactions,” writes Sidley Austin associate Amadeus Moeser.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSome examples:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePrivate equity firms like KKR, Sycamore, and Golden Gate Capital have built up “toehold” stakes in public companies (usually under 5%) as a means of getting in front of management to start talking buyout options.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAnd activists like Elliott Management have started buying entire companies, typically a strategy reserved for PE.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eOne reason Robin Thicke is playing: \u003c/strong\u003eActivist investors and private equity often target similar types of companies, making it easy to swap investment strategies. As long as you change something so the teacher doesn’t notice.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eStill...\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThere could be a reason KKR is exploring hard-line options for D\u0026B—such as board changes—that don’t really seem like options:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eDave \u0026 Buster’s stock had fallen 18.5% in a year before Friday’s announcement.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe chain has almost $1.9 billion of debt. Its market cap was about $1.3 billion Thursday.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt said this week that same-store sales will fall 2.5% to 3% in the fiscal year that ends early February.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAfter KKR disclosed the stake, Dave \u0026 Buster’s shares climbed 12.7% Friday.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\"
